channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How 3 Hawaiian teen princes brought surfing to the mainland
item.description: In 1885, royal Hawaiian brothers were studying at a military school in California. There, they introduced a sport known as "surfboard swimming." The P...

item.title: Can young Americans still have a better life than their parents? We want to know
item.description: For many Gen Z and millennial Americans, concerns about finances and the economy can feel ever present. NPR wants to know how economic barriers are af...

item.title: 2025 Pokémon World Championships show how competitive the game still is
item.description: The annual event pits some of the trading card and video game's most seasoned players against each other — and it demonstrates how Pokémon has maintai...

item.title: Trump administration cancels $679 million for offshore wind projects at ports
item.description: Ports across the country were planning to become economic hubs for the growing offshore wind industry. The Trump administration is cancelling grants t...

item.title: Don't let a selfie be the end of you
item.description: Selfies can be great fun — or horribly dangerous. India, which has tallied hundreds of injuries and deaths from risky selfie-taking, is urging folks t...

item.title: The Millionaire, the Model & the Hit Man
item.description: A millionaire is willing to shell out $80,000 to have someone kill his model wife. What could possibly go wrong? "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts...

item.title: Tennis star meets fan after US Open hat snatching viral video
item.description: Kamil Majchrzak shared a clip of him meeting the boy, after a viral video appeared to show a spectator depriving him of one.

item.title: Susan Zirinsky pays tribute to CBS correspondent Mark Knoller
item.description: Mark Knoller​ may be the only person in Washington, D.C., who was revered by both Republican and Democratic presidents.

item.title: Book excerpt: "It Doesn't Have to Hurt" by Dr. Sanjay Gupta
item.description: In his new book, the neurosurgeon and chief medical correspondent for CNN writes about chronic pain, and the innovative techniques now being used to s...

item.title: "John's Version": John Fogerty on re-recording Creedence Clearwater Revival hits
item.description: One of the founding members of Creedence Clearwater Revival lost control of his own songs when the band broke up in the early 1970s. Now, after buying...

item.title: Head-on crash between police van and prison bus kills 14 in Namibia
item.description: Eleven members of the prison service and a police officer were among the fatalities.

item.title: Illinois Gov. Pritzker says sending troops to Chicago would be an "invasion"
item.description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker told CBS News that President Trump has "other aims" aside from fighting crime, as he vows to crack down in Chicago.

item.title: Putin, Modi and other world leaders in China for summit
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are among the 20 world leaders attending a regional security summit in China.

item.title: Australian state to ban iconic fish-shaped soy sauce bottles
item.description: The plastic containers have become a staple in many Asian restaurants and takeaways around the world.

item.title: Indonesian politicians to have perks cut in bid to quell unrest
item.description: The move aims to subdue anti-government demonstrations that have swept across the country.

item.title: Montana man who evaded authorities for a week after bar shooting faces four counts of murder
Trump taps federal agents to tackle local policing. That’s not always helpful, critics say
